title: Easeout Weekly #25
body:
![Netlify Puzzle](/images/uploads/netlify-million-devs.jpg) [The Making of: Netlify’s Million Devs SVG Animation Site](https://css-tricks.com/the-making-of-netlifys-million-devs-svg-animation-site/) The following article captures the process of building the Million Developers microsite for [Netlify](https://www.netlify.com/?utm_source=csstricks&utm_medium=million-sd&utm_campaign=devex). This project was built by a few folks and we’ve captured some parts of the process of building it here. [Read it ➡️](https://css-tricks.com/the-making-of-netlifys-million-devs-svg-animation-site/)
![Bricks with gaps](/images/uploads/bricks-with-gaps.png) [A Lightweight Masonry Solution](https://css-tricks.com/a-lightweight-masonry-solution/) Firefox is now implementing masonry in CSS via an experimental feature. This tutorial shows us how to set it up, including a JavaScript fallback for the rest. [Read it ➡️](https://css-tricks.com/a-lightweight-masonry-solution/)
![Redux For Use In A Real-World Application Article Card](/images/uploads/redux-real-world-application.png) [Setting Up Redux For Use In A Real-World Application](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/08/redux-real-world-application/) It's fairly simple to learn the concepts and implement Redux in a simple app. Going from a simple counter app to a real-world app, however, can be quite the jump! [Read it ➡️](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/08/redux-real-world-application/)
![TypeScript Logo](/images/uploads/typscript-hollow.png) [TypeScript, Minus TypeScript](https://css-tricks.com/typescript-minus-typescript/) TypeScript is incredibly powerful, but is often difficult to read for beginners and carries the overhead of needing a compilation step before it can run in a browser. Let's take a more detailed look! [Read it ➡️](https://css-tricks.com/typescript-minus-typescript/)
![Draw your favourite cars example](/images/uploads/draw-your-favorite-car-examples.png) [How To Create A Porsche 911 With Sketch (Part 3)](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/08/porsche-911-sketch-tutorial-part-3/) This tutorial is geared more towards experienced illustrators, but if you’re new to Sketch, you should be able to profit from it, too. Be sure to check out [Part 1](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/07/porsche-911-sketch-tutorial-part-1/) and [Part 2](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/07/porsche-911-sketch-tutorial-part-2/) first! [Read it ➡️](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/08/porsche-911-sketch-tutorial-part-3/)
![Smashing Checklists Header](/images/uploads/checklists-header.png) [Smart Interface Design Patterns In Your Pocket: Checklist Cards PDF](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/08/checklist-cards-release/) Meet Smashing Magazines' *Smart Interface Design Patterns Checklist Cards*, a deck of 100 cards with questions to ask when designing and building any interface component [Read it ➡️](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/08/checklist-cards-release/)
![Flatfile Importer](/images/uploads/flatfile-data-import.png) [Building Custom Data Importers: What Engineers Need to Know](https://css-tricks.com/building-custom-data-importers-what-engineers-need-to-know/) In this article, we’ll address the current problems with importing data and discuss a few key product features that are necessary to consider if you’re faced with a decision to build an in-house solution. [Read it ➡️](https://css-tricks.com/building-custom-data-importers-what-engineers-need-to-know/)
![A Practical Guide To Product Tours In React Apps Aritcle Card](/images/uploads/guide-product-tours-react-apps.png) [A Practical Guide To Product Tours In React Apps](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/08/guide-product-tours-react-apps/) In the following guide, you’ll learn how to proactively use product tours to onboard users into a new and complex UX, and how to familiarize them with UI functionality without boring them, using a typical React app. [Read it ➡️](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/08/guide-product-tours-react-apps/)
![Sapper And Strapi](/images/uploads/static-blog-sapper-strapi.png) [Creating A Static Blog With Sapper And Strapi](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/08/static-blog-sapper-strapi/) This article will take you through how to build a Svelte-powered static blog with Sapper and Strapi, as well as how to deploy the website to Netlify. [Read it ➡️](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/08/static-blog-sapper-strapi/)
![HTML Headings Depiction](/images/uploads/headings-subheadings.png) [HTML for Subheadings and Headings](https://css-tricks.com/html-for-subheadings-and-headings/) A neat look into some considerations to make when structuring HTML headings. [Read it ➡️](https://css-tricks.com/html-for-subheadings-and-headings/)
![Shoptalk Logo](/images/uploads/shoptalk.png) [Web Components, Frameworks vs Vanilla, Accessible Numbers, and SVG Memory Usage](https://shoptalkshow.com/424/) A look at web components and web component libraries, when and why you should use a framework vs vanilla HTML/CSS/JS, how to make phone numbers more accessible, trying to figure out state, and some thoughts on SVG memory usage. [Listen up ➡️](https://shoptalkshow.com/424/)
![Contrast Example](/images/uploads/contrast-bg.png) [Nailing the Perfect Contrast Between Light Text and a Background Image](https://css-tricks.com/nailing-the-perfect-contrast-between-light-text-and-a-background-image/) Trying to stamp out poor text contrast on background images is a lot like playing Whac-a-Mole. Instead of guessing, we can solve this problem with HTML `` and a little bit of math. [Read it ➡️](https://css-tricks.com/nailing-the-perfect-contrast-between-light-text-and-a-background-image/)

short: A weekly roundup of the latest web design & development news.
